intro: Paronychia arabica var. tripolitana, commonly known as the Tripoli sandthrift, is a low-growing, mat-forming succulent native to the arid regions of North Africa. It features small, fleshy leaves that are typically gray-green in color, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
